intro: Erodium praecox f. vernale, commonly known as the early common stork's bill, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Geraniaceae family and is characterized by its small, pink or purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows to a height of about 20–40 cm and has heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found along roadsides and in open fields. Its seeds are dispersed by wind, contributing to its ability to colonize new areas.
